All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback
Direct Known Subclasses:
MainActivityDemoActivity
public abstract class DemoActivity
extends android.app.Activity

Base class of DemoAcitivities. These activities demonstrate the usage of a given activity. They are transparent and will get displayed on top of the activity to demonstrate. They display a list of LabeledPoint inside a DrawView. When subclassing this class, you only have to override getDrawViewAdapter() and provide a custom DrawViewAdapter that will act as model for the DrawView, giving it all data to draw both texts and associated drawables at given locations. To start subclasses of this Activity, proceed as follow : 

 boolean neverShowDemoAgain = AbstractDemoActivity.isNeverShowAgain( this, demoActivityId );
 
 if ( !neverShowDemoAgain ) {
     //create an ArrayList named arrayListPoints.
 
     Intent intent = new Intent( this,  );
     DemoActivity.prepareDemoActivityIntent( intent, demoActivityId, arrayListPoints );
     startActivity( intent );
 }
And don't forget to declare your DemoActivity subclass in the AndroidManifest file !

Author:
sni

getDrawViewAdapter

public abstract DrawViewAdapter getDrawViewAdapter()
Must be overriden by any custom DemoActivity to provide a DrawViewAdapter to the DrawView.

Returns:
an adapter that will be passed to the DrawView.
